bio:
A Russian guy from Budapest. I studied in ITMO University, where I read Wireless Telecommunication. Later, I worked in a telecommunication vendor as an integration engineer with a rather broad scope of responsibilities.

Currently, I'm working as a Test Automation Engineer in Ericsson. So, I mainly create, edit, run, debug, analyse unit tests for the company's radio equipment. Main fraimwork there is Java TestNG.

My other interests include web development (front and back), linguistics and literary translation.
projBasic: This is the list of some personal or hobby projects I was involved into or made. It turns out that the majority of them is somehow related to the Japanese rock band Asian Kung-Fu Generation. It's just that I'm a fan of theirs so I run a couple of projects about their music. But for me it's a great hobby and an excelent practice to hone my skills.
projSms:
SMS Converter

A JS-based tool to convert SM bodies to and from human-readable form.

It allows to convert SMS bodies from GSM7, UCS2 and 8-bit to text, vice versa.

Used technologies are HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript.
projFragments:
akfgfragments.com

A simple theme for a WordPress-based site for akfgfragments.com site I own and administrate.

Used technologies are PHP, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, WordPress.
projAkgDb:
Ajikan Database

This is a little project that allows anyone to get info about records that a certain song of a band Asian Kung-Fu Generation is on.

The project contains of backend (MariaDB database and NodeJS/express server) and frontend (ReactJS, CSS).

Used technologies are ReactJS, NodeJS, CSS.
projAwp:
Ajikan Worldwide Project

A one-page site dedicated to the song cover project of one particular music band.

Used technologies are JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap.
